ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: experience with applied mathematics research, self-motivated work, and planning & executing a major project
How to conduct theoretical research
I learned a lot through my individual research. The course itself didn't provide much.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Get a good advisor and the rest is easy.
I wish the requirements and deadlines were better communicated

Strengths: get your degree. 

Weaknesses: there is minimal guidance and unclear standards, makes the whole process unnecessarily stressful
The course gives us a lot of freedom and latitude to define our work which is great, but I would love to see more structure and clear expectations for the thesis project & write-up in the future.
More clarity on the deliverables

The course provides no structure for the senior research project, which is unfortunate. I feel that my senior project would've gone more smoothly if I had had more instruction from the Applied Math department.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Na
Nothing much succeeded. Everything that went well was because of my advisor and post-doc.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Its required
If youre reading this you have to take it
Yes, doing a thesis is super important and rewarding but obviously a lot of work. Be prepared to keep your own schedule and lean on your own motivation.
All senior math majors must take it anyway
You have to take it because it's a requirement for Applied Math! Pick an advisor well.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Weekly advisor meetings on Zoom
meetings with professor

Zoom and Google Collab
